balanceOf(uint256,address).details: This function will always return 0 for any address not involved in the stream

params.streamId: The ID of the stream you're looking up
params.who: The address of the party you want to know the balance of

returns._0: The ERC20 balance of the specified party

refuel(uint256,uint256).details: Remember to call approve(<address of this contract>, <amount or greater>) on the ERC20's contract before calling this function

params.amount: The amount of tokens to lock
params.streamId: The ID for the stream that you are locking the tokens for
The ID for the stream you are receiving the excess for

streamTo(address,address,uint256,(uint25.details: Remember to call approve(<address of this contract>, <initialBalance or greater>) on the ERC20's contract before calling this function

params.initialBalance: How many ERC20 tokens to lock on the contract. Note that only the locked amount is guaranteed to be delivered to `recipient`
params.paymentPerBlock: How many tokens to deliver for each block the stream is active
params.recipient: The address that will receive the streamed tokens
params.timeframe: An interval of time, defined in block numbers, during which the stream will be active
params.token: The ERC20 token that will get streamed

returns._0: The ID of the created stream

params.paymentPerBlock: The new rate at which tokens will get streamed
params.sig: The signature of the other affected party for this change, certifying they approve of it
params.streamId: The ID for the stream which is getting its configuration updated
params.timeframe: The new interval, defined in blocks, the stream will be active for

params.streamId: The ID for the stream you are withdrawing the tokens from

balanceOf(uint256,address).notice: Check the balance of any of the involved parties on a stream

nonce().notice: Signature nonce, incremented with each successful execution or state change

refuel(uint256,uint256).notice: Increase the amount of locked tokens for a certain token stream

refund(uint256).notice: Withdraw any excess in the locked balance, only available to the creator of the stream after it's no longer active

streamTo(address,address,uint256,(uint25.notice: Create a stream that continously delivers tokens to `recipient`

updateDetails(uint256,uint256,(uint256,u.notice: Update the rate at which tokens get streamed, or the interval the stream is active for. Requires both parties to authorise the change

withdraw(uint256).notice: Receive some of the streamed tokens, only available to the receiver of the stream
